title: Senior Systems Engineer, Application Provisioning, Ingka Group
description:
**Job ID:** 265791


**Date posted:** 11/11/2024

  

  

  

TOGETHER AS A TEAM  

  

Are you ready to join us on our journey of creativity, collaboration, and making everyday life better for millions of people around the world? Here at INGKA, we are now looking for a Senior System Engineer to join us in Application Provisioning.
  

  

Here at INGKA, our Senior System engineers are the architects of possibility, the guardians of reliability, and the champions of innovation. They are the heroes behind the scenes, transforming complexity into clarity and chaos into order. With them, we have the foundation for a future limited only by our imagination.  

  

We are now looking for a senior system engineer who can lead the architectural agenda and transformation of Application Provisioning.  

  

Within Application provisioning, you will be responsible for driving the strategy and vision for how our many co-workers and consultants should consume and engage with software and applications. You will work with Enterprise application delivery platforms with a focus on Citrix & Nutanix technology portfolio.
  

  

Within Application provisioning, you will be responsible for driving the strategy and vision for how our many co-workers and consultants should consume and engage with software and applications. You will work across two areas, Virtual apps & desktops which are the central hosting of published business applications and virtual desktop infrastructure and Web apps & portals which host and automate global published Web applications from our internal data centres across Europe, North America and Asia. The primary focus will be Virtual apps & Desktops.  

  

Come and be a part of something extraordinary and let's create a better every day together.  

  

WHO YOU ARE  

  

Key Previous experience and proven skills:  

  

* Strong knowledge of Citrix Virtual apps and desktop technology. Passionate about delivering great user experience with a strong focus on high availability and security.
* Strong knowledge of operations engineering practices using industry-standard toolsets
* Deep knowledge of working in agile/iterative software development teams and with agile development practices
* Good understanding of the cost drivers and effective leveraging of service delivery as well as the commercial consequences of technical decisions
* Deep knowledge of technology, design and architecture concepts (i.e. microservices)
* Good knowledge of how to transform and optimise the area
* Strong knowledge of coaching techniques
* Good knowledge of IKEAs corporate identity, core values and vision of creating a better everyday life for the many people

  

Qualities we look for:
  

  

* Passionate about the delivery of high-quality products and technology services
* Motivated by continuously developing and enhancing self and others in technology skills and staying at the frontier of modern tools and technologies
* Energised by working both independently and in cross-functional teams
* Motivated by working agile and being open to change
* Motivated by sharing and living the IKEA culture and values

  

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING DAY TO DAY  

  

You will be responsible for:  

* Responsible for ensuring the overall solution and implementation across products from a technical engineering perspective to fit together in the scope of a sub-domain, aligned with strategies and direction to maintain consistency and alignment with the broader IKEA ecosystem.
* Lead the security work for the Products/Services in the domain.
* Lead the planning and designing for implementing security by design on a technical level and ensuring legislation and requirements on a compliance level.
* Align with Enterprise Architecture on design and integrate products and services from the broader perspective and on the domain level. Ensure scaling, performance, and support across domains in the service and product landscape.
* Lead the work of benchmarking and continuous evaluation of the systems, technologies used and product/service scopes to ensure optimization across the domain.
* Lead adoption of design patterns, efficient usage of cross-cutting technology platforms and solutions to reuse across product teams in the (sub-) domain to enable efficiency and avoid unnecessary duplications.
* Responsible for being the leading digital workplace service integrator in terms of architectural roadmap and guidance for selected products and services.
* Together with the service integrator of Digital Workplace co-design a technology service through automation and self-service capabilities for efficiency, availability and usability.
* Design and educate in ways of working for other engineers as well as service integrators encouraging good practices to meet consumer expectations on Service delivery.
* Ensure and review systems compliance towards legislations, policies or other requirements to stay compliant.
* Take the lead in change activities in different environments to secure functionality and availability, coaching other team members through the process.
* Take responsibility for cooperation and align key stakeholders within Ingka and Inter-IKEA Systems with interdependencies towards Group Digital to develop Product/Service design and technical roadmaps.
* Contribute with expertise to the various Product Teams in tasks that require optimization/modifications to the current design.
* Lead in promoting and advocating good engineering practices within an agile/iterative development approach to improve time to market.
* Onboard, coach and mentor engineers to secure transfer of competence and enable a high-performing team.
* Proactively manage relevant organizational processes, to drive an intended outcome.
* Ensure that Services are built according to best practices by continually learning from and benchmarking against industry standards to continuously validate and improve deliverables.

  

QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT?
  

  

This role is based in Helsingborg or Malmö, Sweden and you will report to the Service Manager of Application provisioning.
  

  

In this recruitment there is no relocation support provided by IKEA, hence we're looking for people already living or within commuting distance of the mentioned locations of the role.
  

  

For more information about the role, please reach out to the hiring manager, Ferenc Horvath, Service Manager for Application Provisioning, Digital Workplace.  

  

If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to tech recruiters at ashurina.aorahim@ingka.com or carl-johan.andersson@ingka.ikea.com
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Product Mastery
description:
**Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

It’s crystal clear: the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. At Volvo Cars, we embrace change. We’re committed to transforming the automotive industry and leading in electrification. For this, we’re seeking out more creative minds to shape that future. Don’t miss this opportunity to create your tomorrow.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



You will serve as the Product Owner for two teams. One team is responsible for implementing an onboard measurement data API, also known as a data collection framework, which gathers data from various vehicle sources such as video and LIDAR, supporting systems like AD/ADAS and others. The second team focuses on calibration and data collection, supporting standards such as XCP and UDS, as well as host log.


Both teams consist of skilled software engineers who are passionate about software development. Currently, the teams develop in C and C++ and primarily deploy on HPA. This role will enable you to build and maintain a broad personal network both within and outside the team. As part of our team, you will gain access to long-term development opportunities in a dynamic and continuously growing field.


**What you'll do**
------------------

  

As a Product Owner, your primary responsibilities revolve around managing the team’s backlog, ensuring product quality, and fostering collaboration.

  


* You will own the backlog, creating, prioritizing, and refining stories, defect reports, and enablers. This includes reviewing and reprioritizing the backlog as part of iteration planning and coordinating dependencies with other Product Owners and stakeholders.
* Together with the team, you’ll work on drafting and developing acceptance criteria for stories, refining the backlog to maximize understanding and minimize handovers.
* Planning is essential; you’ll develop and maintain both short-term and long-term strategies, ensuring that product safety requirements are met and documented prior to release.
* Additionally, you’ll collaborate with System and Solution Architects to sequence technological infrastructure and make informed decisions regarding enabler work.
* Quality assurance will be a key focus, as you will accept or reject stories based on acceptance criteria, acceptance tests, and the Definition of Done (DoD), thereby maintaining high standards.

  




You’ll also lead the team’s objective-setting for program syncs and participate in Sprint Team Demos and Retrospectives, fostering a continuous improvement culture.


**What you'll bring**
---------------------



We are looking for an experienced and curious person with previous experience in cross-functional collaboration as well as a strong sense of business insight. Strong people management, collaboration and communication skills are essential when working in a diverse and international setting. It is also important that you are continuously developing your own skills and guide and coach your teams to continuously develop theirs.

  


* M.Sc or B.Sc. degree in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering or equivalent
* Ability to communicate technical information to the team and stakeholders
* Ability to translate customer needs into product features and stories
* Ability on creating and communicating product roadmaps
* Ability to deliver clear, concise reports on the product's status, risks, and timelines.
* Ability to understand SW testing, CI/CD, test automation and validation
* Skilled in conflict resolution to manage differences of opinion among team members or stakeholders
* Strong presentation skills to articulate the product vision, progress, and technical details to stakeholders.
* Previous SW development experience and familiarity with embedded systems is an advantage
* Knowledge of Agile frameworks like Scrum and Kanban
* Knowledge using JIRA



**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Neha Mehta at neha.mehta@volvocars.com. For specific questions about the position, please reach out to Hiring Manager Yair Klecki at yair.klecki@volvocars.com.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 27th th of NOV 2024. We’re excited to get to know you!

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!

title: Lead UE Tools Engineer
description:
**WHAT MAKES US EPIC?**
-----------------------



At the core of Epic's success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it's building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we're always innovating.



Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We're constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

**ENGINEERING - UNREAL ENGINE**
-------------------------------


### **What We Do**



Unreal-powered projects have been on the bleeding edge of real-time entertainment for over 20 years. Our team of engineering experts are always innovating to improve the tools and technology that empower content developers worldwide.


### **What You'll Do**



We are looking for a Lead Tools Engineer who is passionate about writing world building tools for artists. You will help develop the next generation of tools used by the leading artists in the industry. You will make a direct impact on the creativity and productivity of artists across the world. This role requires leading and mentoring a team of engineers, along with hands-on development.


### **In this role, you will**


* Lead a team of software engineers with varying levels of experience and mentor junior resources
* Own and develop from scratch in engine world building tools. Use hands-on technical expertise to drive solutions for a range of challenges
* Partner and collaborate with all disciplines (i.e., programmers, artists, and designers) to identify areas for improvements, gather feedback, and design solutions for customer needs
* Set guiding priorities and assign tasks and projects to all team members
* Monitor performance and develop team members through coaching and providing training opportunities
* Design the architecture for main modules and implement well-documented new features
* Creating, optimizing and enhancing algorithms and data structures

### **What we're looking for**


* 6+ years of experience building high-performing, architecturally complex products
* 3+ years of experience with UE in both C++ and Blueprints is required
* 2+ years of leadership or mentorship experience leading other software engineers
* Experience with building highly performant real time experiences
* Experience with code reviews and automated testing
* Excellent communication skills

**EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE**
----------------------------------------



We pay 100% of benefits for employees. Our current benefits package includes cover for life and sick insurance, enhanced sick pay, pension, occupational injury insurance, transportation and health care allowance.

**ABOUT US**
------------



Epic Games spans across 25 countries with 46 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we've been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic's award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.


### **Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!**



Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.


**Note to Recruitment Agencies:** Epic does not accept any unsolicited resumes or approaches from any unauthorized third party (including recruitment or placement agencies) (i.e., a third party with whom we do not have a negotiated and validly executed agreement). We will not pay any fees to any unauthorized third party. Further details on these matters can be found here.

title: Central Technical Support Engineer - Car Service Business
description:
**Let’s shape the future together**
-----------------------------------

  

We’re shaping our business around people. While our cars embrace leading-edge technologies, we never employ technology for its own sake. Quite the opposite. Instead, our focus is on adapting technology to benefit people. This philosophy extends to the sales and customer experience we aim to deliver. Do you want to be a part of creating the exciting solutions of tomorrow’s mobility? Then look no further, join us.

**What you'll do**

title: Software Test Engineer- Automotive
description:
Software Test Engineer- Automotive


SwediumGlobal is seeking for experienced Verification Engineer


If you feel excited about grabbing this onsite career opportunity, we are happy to hear from you!


Location: Gothenburg, Sweden


Job Description:


* Responsibility for quality assuring the future business needs, covering product development, customer verification and aftermarket.
* Driving development of E2E test cases and test plan according to V&V model
* Defining and validating the test environments including MIL, SIL, HIL and actual trucks/vehicles
* Performing log analysis and drawing conclusions of delivered test results along with the function developers and Product owner
* Finding the root cause for end-to-end level issues.
* Securing quality to release SW with confidence
* Make data driven decision and approve sw for relevant release eg. Sw recommended to be used in the truck for driving inside the fence or out on public roads


  

**Key attributes**  

* Verification: Responsible for preparing the test environment for the verification activities to be performed. Perform regression verification according to software release plan.
* Collaboration: Ensure the required information is gathered for the verification activities to be performed properly. Likewise, provide feedback to concerned stakeholders on relevant information observed during verification activities.
* Documentation: Prepare reports to concerned stakeholders summarizing the findings throughout the verification activities.
* Problem Solving: Be curious, pro-active, look for root cause as an extra-mile.
* Continuous Improvement: Observe opportunities for improvement in the verification way of working. Stay updated on the latest automated verification methodologies, tools, and technologies to enhance testing efficiency and accuracy.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's or master's degree in electrical engineering, Computer Engineering, Automotive Engineering, or a related field.
* 10+ years of experience in verification or validation within the automotive sector.


* Hands-on experience with automotive communication protocols (CAN, LIN, Ethernet).
* Experience with verification tools (ex: CANoe, CANalyzer, or similar).
* Experience with writing test cases based on requirements.
* Experience with requirements based testing and exploratory testing.


* End user function testing at SIL, HIL and Vehicle
* SW deployment services at aftermarket and/or production
* CAN, LIN, J1939, UDS protocol
* CANalyzer/ CANOE environment, dSpace, ASM, GSP, Configuration management

title: Teknisk skribent
description:
Teknisk Skribent till Qvantum Energi i Åstorp
  
Vi söker nu en driven och detaljorienterad teknisk skribent med ingenjörsbakgrund som kan hjälpa oss att skapa högkvalitativa dokument och manualer för våra produkter. Om du trivs med att skriva tekniska instruktioner och är skicklig på att anpassa komplex information till olika målgrupper, då kan det här vara rollen för dig!
  
Om rollen
  
  

**Som teknisk skribent hos oss kommer du att:**  

Skapa och redigera tekniska dokumentationer såsom användarmanualer, installationsguider och produktbeskrivningar.
  
Samverka med ingenjörer, produktutvecklare och andra teammedlemmar för att samla in och förtydliga teknisk information.
  
Säkerställa att all teknisk dokumentation är uppdaterad, korrekt och enkel att förstå för användaren.
  
  

Kvalifikationer
  
  

**Vi söker dig som har:**  

Utbildning som maskiningenjör eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
  
Erfarenhet av att arbeta som teknisk skribent eller i en liknande roll.
  
Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
  
Förmåga att förstå tekniska specifikationer och omvandla dem till lättlästa och användbara texter.
  
Detaljfokus och en hög känsla för struktur och tydlighet.
  
  

Meriterande erfarenheter
  
Kunskap inom teknikområdet, gärna erfarenhet av värmepumpar
  
Grundläggande kunskaper i HTML, CSS eller annan kod som är relevant för teknisk dokumentation.
  
  

Om oss
  
We are a group of people who think differently, have a passion for entrepreneurship and strive to maintain a flat organization where we are all expected to make a difference. We believe in making the impossible possible together – by building on everyone’s personal strengths. Our goal is to change the way cities in Europe are heated and cooled, do you want to shape the future with us?
  
Our world is in the midst of an energy transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources. At Qvantum, we have developed a solution to tackle a difficult challenge that no one has been able to solve before – how to enable the many people in the big cities to live a life without dependence on fossil fuels for heating and cooling at an affordable price. We have developed a wide range of smart heat pump solutions for the next generation of heating and cooling technologies, built on modern software. The products are suitable for everything from small apartments to large property complexes and entire residential blocks.
  
Qvantum, with over 30 years of experience in heat pumps, has recently embarked on an exciting and extensive growth journey. A number of entrepreneurs, with extensive experience from both the heat pump industry and the energy industry, acquired the company and we are in the middle of the expansion. We are currently more than 250 colleagues, located in 8 different countries, and we continue to grow at a rapid pace. With factories in Limhamn, Åstorp and Hungary, Qvantum is expected to become one of the leading players in its segment in Europe.
  
We offer exciting development opportunities, an inclusive work environment that encourages professional and personal development together with dynamic and forward-thinking teammates. Two of the benefits that Qvantum offers are the opportunity to work flexibly, both from home and in the office, as well as a long-term stock option program. Now you have a unique opportunity to be part of an exciting growth journey!
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Full Stack Engineer
job_function: Engineering, Business Development, and Information Technology
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
**Job Title: Full Stack Developer** 




**Location:** 
 Stockholm, hybrid
 



**Salary** 
 : 700k SEK + benefits
 



  





**Job Overview:** 




 As a Full Stack Developer, you will play a key role in creating high-quality, responsive applications that meet our business needs. This role emphasises front-end development using technologies like Angular, paired with back-end expertise in C#.
 



  





 A crucial part of your responsibilities will include implementing robust testing frameworks and strategies to ensure that the applications are error-free and meet quality standards. You will work in a dynamic, agile environment, collaborating closely with both technical and non-technical team members to deliver scalable, maintainable, and user-centric solutions.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, develop, and maintain applications with a focus on front-end technologies like Angular, along with back-end services in C#.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features in an iterative, agile manner.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications through testing and optimisation.
* Conduct code reviews, lead refactoring activities, and provide guidance to enhance code quality, application architecture, and ensure adherence to best practices.
* Participate in all phases of the agile development cycle, from planning and development to testing and deployment.
* Assist in task estimation, risk identification, and strategising solutions, focusing on non-functional requirements and maintainability of the code.
* Stay updated with the latest trends in technology, standards, and front-end technologies.



  





**Skills and Qualifications:** 



* Proven experience as a full stack developer with a strong emphasis on front-end development.
* Proficient with front-end technologies including Angular.
* Solid experience in C# and back-end development.
* Experience with Microservices and Kubernetes.
* Knowledge of API design and development.
* Strong understanding of the Agile development methodology and best practices.
* Excellent problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication and teamwork skills.



  





**Education and Experience:** 



* BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* 5+ years of proven software development and automated testing experience.



  





 If you're interested in learning more or have questions about the role please feel free to get in touch

title: Senior Back End Developer - Java
description:
**Job Listing: Senior Backend Developer (Java)** 




**Location** 
 : Stockholm, with flexibility to work remotely (
 **preferably 2 days in-office per week**
 )
 



**Salary** 
 : Starting from 55,000 SEK/month
 



**Swedish Language Required** 




  





 Our client is a dynamic, well-positioned scale-up offering a unique SaaS solution aimed at transforming the management of trade documents. Since 2016, they've been developing a patented platform that enables businesses—primarily large banks, trade forwarders, shippers, and corporations involved in exports/imports—to handle negotiable documents digitally, reducing reliance on traditional paper processes. Their solution allows original documents to remain with the owner while facilitating secure, digital negotiations and transactions, even for non-customers.
 



 With a strong customer base and new growth ambitions, they’re now expanding their product to serve small and medium-sized enterprises via an online channel. This role will play a pivotal part in developing this new online sales platform.
 



  





**Position Overview:** 




 Our client is seeking an experienced
 **Senior Backend Developer** 
 with a focus on Java to contribute to the development and enhancement of their SaaS platform. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a forward-thinking company with ambitious growth plans.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop, enhance, and maintain backend components for a scalable SaaS platform.
* Collaborate on a new project aimed at expanding the client’s product reach to smaller businesses via an online account setup platform.
* Contribute to both new development projects and the enhancement of the core product.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* **5+ years of experience** 
 in backend development with
 **Java** 
 (Spring Boot).
* Familiarity with
 **AWS** 
 and
 **Docker** 
 is beneficial.
* Basic experience with frontend development (Vue.js preferred; React or Angular are also acceptable).
* Experience working on SaaS platforms.
* A degree in
 **Engineering** 
 or
 **Computer Science** 
 is ideal.
* Experience with integrating
 **Stripe** 
 payment solutions is a plus.



  





**Work Environment:** 



* Hybrid model: While our client offers the flexibility to work remotely, they prefer someone open to attending the newly refurbished office at least 2 days a week.



  





**Why Join?** 



* Opportunity to contribute to a
 **high-growth phase** 
 with a company that has unique, patented technology.
* Join a team dedicated to innovation and advancing the digitalization of negotiable documents—a first in their industry.
* Work with stable, reputable clients including large banks and corporations.
* Exciting upcoming plans for product development and market expansion.



  





**Benefits:** 



* Standard pension plan
* Wellness allowance
* Health insurance coverage
* Provision of all necessary working equipment



  





 If you’re passionate about driving product innovation and want to join a company on the cusp of significant growth, apply today!

title: Backend Java Engineer – Shape the Future of Global Streaming
description:
Are you a experienced Java developer passionate about building scalable systems that reach millions of users globally? Join a cutting-edge team where your expertise will directly impact how people discover and enjoy their favorite audio content every day. If you’ve ever been curious about shaping the future of how the world listens, this role could be music to your ears.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 Immediate or by agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 As a backend engineer, you will work on developing and maintaining the infrastructure that drives users to sign up for our paid product. You will collaborate with other teams in R&D, Marketing, and Growth to strengthen our platform’s capabilities and support the growing demands of our product portfolio. Our goal is to create a user-centered, automated conversion experience that is consistent across multiple channels.
   

 You'll be part of a mission-driven team responsible for enhancing the experience of millions of users globally, from casual listeners to dedicated fans, working on features that resonate with a wide audience. Our platform handles millions of streams daily, and you'll contribute to optimizing systems that ensure seamless playback and discovery for users everywhere.
 


  


  

**Please note that to be considered for this position, your CV must be submitted in English!**



**Work tasks**
  
* Design and develop scalable backend systems, data models, and APIs on the Google Cloud Platform.
  
* Build and maintain Java services that support our content platform, enabling marketing operators and other internal teams to work efficiently.
  
* Serve as a technical leader, mentor, and key contributor within a cross-functional agile team.
  
* Work closely with engineers and product managers to tackle complex challenges and scale automation efforts for a more user-focused conversion experience.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* 5+ years of experience as a backend engineer, with a strong focus on Java.
  
* Solid understanding of computer science fundamentals and experience building scalable backend services.
  
* Experience with cloud-based development on platforms like GCP or AWS.
  
* Ability to design and develop APIs in close collaboration with stakeholders.
  
* Experience working in cross-functional teams and independently leading complex delivery initiatives.
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Experience working with large-scale streaming platforms
  
* Familiarity with technologies like gRPC, BigQuery, Bigtable, or other Google Cloud tools.
  
* Experience writing and operating distributed, high-volume services in production.
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role you are curious, solution-oriented, and passionate about developing scalable systems. You enjoy working in teams and are motivated by contributing to the company’s success and mission.**



  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Sabrin Kanone or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth2@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15108080

title: Game Developer
description:
At Coody, we're revolutionizing consulting by combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment. With us, you'll receive a maxed out salary with a full benefit package, the opportunity to work remotely and assignments that are both fun and challenging.
   

  

 On average, joining Coody means increasing your salary by 44%. How do we do it?
   

  

 The math is simple. We pay you more by cutting unnecessary costs — no overpaid bosses, no luxurious conferences, and no fancy offices. Instead, we invest in what matters: you.
   

  

 Coody is all about giving you as an individual the chance to have a free and flexible life to live for your own priorities. Welcome to Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

**Gravity Free Consulting @ Coody Means:**
* Maximized Compensation: Typically a 44% salary increase.
* Safety & Comfort: Employment with a generous benefits package.
* Freedom & Flexibility: No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
* Shaping the Future: Assignments with industry innovators like Embark, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, Paradox, Mojang, Varjo, and exciting startups and scale-ups.


**About Us**
 Coody is a growing and dynamic group of people who are the tech stars of the future. We consists of about 13 different nationalities and work on assignments for digital game changers across Sweden, Finland, USA and the UK, in industries such as EV, Gaming, AI, MedTech, AR and FinTech.
   

  

 We’re more than a company — we’re a community platform. Our approach is built on trust and autonomy. We keep corporate bullshit to a minimum and focus on what benefits our consultants most. Explore our employee handbook for more insight into a genuine supportive, consultant-first environment.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 As a Game Development Consultant at Coody, you'll work on technically and intellectually challenging, fun assignments that strengthen client teams and projects. You will gain experience from diverse assignments within the gaming industry, ranging from heart-pounding action games to captivating story-driven adventures. With us, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant contribution and bring your creative vision to life.
   

  

 You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience in software development
* Some experience from building experiences in gaming, VR/AR och similar
* Deep understanding of one or more technical areas stated below
* Fluency in English (verbal and written)
* Experience working in an agile environment
* A doer's mindset with a proven track record of getting things done


**WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE THAT YOU HAVE**
**Deep knowledge within at least one game engine, framework or programming language,** 
 for example; Unity, Unreal, C#, C++, Rust, JavaScript
   

  

**A degree** 
 in Computer Science, Engineering, Game Development, or a related field
   

  

 If Gravity Free Consulting at Coody aligns with your goals, and you bring the skills we're seeking, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today, and we’ll get back to you within a week if your profile fits our needs.

title: Animation Programmer
description:
**Animation Programmer – Bring Characters to Life in Our Next Big Adventure!** 




 Are you passionate about breathing life into digital characters? Do you dream in frame rates and keyframes? We’re on the lookout for an Animation Programmer to join our team of creators, innovators, and gaming enthusiasts. If crafting seamless, immersive animations is your calling, we’d love to see what you can bring to the game world!
 



**What** 
 You’ll Do
 


* Collaborate with designers and animators to create fluid, lifelike animations for all characters, creatures, and in-game objects.


* Develop and optimize animation systems in a cutting-edge game engine to ensure the smoothest gameplay experience across multiple platforms.


* Integrate both keyframe and motion capture data, adding depth and personality to characters.


* Tackle challenges in IK (Inverse Kinematics), physics integration, and blending techniques, ensuring realistic, responsive character interactions.


* Work closely with gameplay programmers to align animation with core mechanics, making every movement feel purposeful.



**Who** 
 You Are
 


* **Proficient in C++ or C#** 
 : You know these languages inside out, allowing you to script efficient, effective animation solutions.


* **Experienced with Game Engines** 
 : Unity, Unreal Engine, or similar – you know how to push them to their limits.


* **An Animation Enthusiast** 
 : You understand the intricacies of FK, IK, and physics-based systems and can work with tools like Maya or Blender to prepare and tweak animations.


* **Optimized and Efficient** 
 : You have an eye for performance, ensuring our animations run smoothly on all platforms.


* **Problem-Solver and Team Player** 
 : Communication is key, and you thrive in a collaborative, creative environment where ideas are shared, tested, and refined.



**Why** 
 Join Us?
 


* **Creative Freedom** 
 : Shape the way players experience character interactions in an open and encouraging atmosphere.


* **Professional Growth** 
 : Work with some of the best minds in the industry, continuously sharpening your skills and expanding your knowledge.


* **Exciting Projects** 
 : Be a part of something big, with projects that push boundaries and redefine genres.



**Ready to make a move? Apply today, and** 
 let’s create something unforgettable together!
 







 This role is a unique opportunity to impact every player's experience. If you’re driven by detail, passion, and innovation, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Software Engineer, Sustaining Engineering
description:
This is a fast-paced engineering role in Linux-based software-defined infrastructure and applications, covering all layers of the stack, including bare metal, virtualization (KVM) and containerization (Docker/LXC/LXD), storage (Ceph and Linux filesystems), networking (OVS, OVN and Core networking), up to OpenStack and Kubernetes, and the open source applications running on top of them. It will challenge you to show the breadth of engineering skill needed to work on almost any aspect of Ubuntu and the open source things people run with it.
   

  

 This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and open source to build a career with Canonical and drive success for our customers, community and the company. If you have an affinity for open source development, great communication skills, and a passion for troubleshooting and fixing issues in technology used by millions across the world, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a remote role, we have teams in all time zones.
   

  

 This role deals with critical issues in the open source stack that require software engineering for upstream bug fixes. Our engineers have to be able to work productively at any level of the stack above the kernel, in a wide range of languages, to understand and address the software issues at hand. Our group is critical to the success of our enterprise customers, partners and Ubuntu itself.
   

  

 You will help with troubleshooting and driving issues to resolution with workarounds, guidance, and bug fixes to be released upstream and in Ubuntu.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Resolve complex customer problems related to Ubuntu, Kernel, Ceph, OpenStack, or Kubernetes and other open source software
* Maintain a close working relationship with Canonical's field, support and product engineering teams
* Participate in upstream communities
* Develop bug fixes, backport patches, and work with upstream for inclusion
* Review code produced by other engineers
* Demonstrate good judgment in technical methods and techniques
* Prioritize work and manage your time effectively against those priorities
* Participate in team discussions to improve processes, tools, and documentation
* Maintain clear, technical and concise communications
* Work from home and travel internationally up to 10% of work time for team meetings, events and conferences


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Professional experience as a software engineer
* Background in Computer Science, STEM or similar
* **Strong** 
 experience with Linux, and at least one of the following:
+ Ceph, OpenStack, Kubernetes or other cloud technologies

* Strong development-level experience with at least one of Python, Go, C or C++ on Linux
* Ability to troubleshoot with debugging tools like gdb
* Familiarity with git source code repositories and branches
* An exceptional academic track record
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* You have interest in, and experience with most of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD, Python, Go, C, Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, distributed systems


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Java Developer to Financial Crime Prevention | SEB, Solna
description:
Financial crime prevention, whether it is combating fraud against our customers, protecting the bank from money laundering, or performing sanction screening, is central not only to SEB but also to society as a whole. If you are interested in working on solutions to screen and monitor transactions, please continue reading!
   

  

 Would you be interested in working with a skilled team of Data Engineering, Java developers and Data Scientists who are responsible for delivering monitoring solutions for SEB?
   

  

 We are currently seeking an experienced Java developer to join us on this important journey!
   

  

 About the role:
   

  

 As a Java Developer in the Financial Crime Prevention team, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining new technical capabilities in a smart way to allow us to detect bad actors. Our technical environment consists of but is not limited to Java, OpenShift, Kafka, Spark and Elastic Search. Here you will have a chance to make a difference and work with challenging tasks. You will have great opportunities to both develop and take further steps in your career working within a highly collaborative environment.
   

  

 You will work in an environment with multiple Agile teams across Sweden and the Baltic states. At SEB, we embrace a hybrid work model, providing employees with eligible roles and tasks to work remotely up to two days a week.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
 To succeed in your role with us you should love solving engineering problems and have the following experiences/ mindset.
   

  

* Extensive experience in Java programming language and Spring Boot.
* Experience building CI/CD pipelines with Github Actions or similar
* Experience with Docker, OpenShift, Kubernetes, ArgoCD, Helm or similar tools
* Experience with in-memory databases like Redis or similar is considered an advantage
* Experience or interest in Scala, Hadoop, Kafka, Spark is considered an advantage
* Analytical mindset and ability to solve complex technical problems
* Passion for challenges to drive your personal development and professional growth
* Being a team player open for growth and learning is crucially important for the role


 What we offer
   

  

 We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
   

  

* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Work-life balance
* International opportunities and working environment
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* Innovative company in forefront of technology


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-12-11. If you have questions about the position, please contact Agnes Kemper at agnes.kemper@seb.se. Please note that we are not able to handle applications via email due to GDPR.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**About Keyfactor**
 Our mission is to build a connected society, rooted in trust, with identity-first security for every machine and human. Keyfactor helps organizations move fast to establish digital trust at scale — and then maintain it. With decades of cybersecurity experience, Keyfactor is trusted by more than 1,500 companies across the globe. We are proud to continually earn recognition as a Best Place to Work, and we achieve that through our amazing people who cultivate our culture as we grow. We hope you will trust your future with Keyfactor!
   

  

**Title:** 
 Senior Software Engineer
   

  

**Location:** 
 Aachen or remote from Germany, Stockholm or remote from Sweden
   

  

**Experience:** 
 Mid-senior
   

  

**Job Function:** 
 Engineering
   

  

**Employment Type:** 
 Full-Time
   

  

**Industry:** 
 Computer & Network Security
   

  

**About The Position**
 Keyfactor is looking for a highly qualified and motivated Senior Software Engineer to join one of our growing agile teams. You will have experience of developing professional software products. Ideally you have had a role in product development or have expertise in full stack development.
   

  

 We live and breathe RSA, X.509, open source and hardware security modules. It is desirable if you have experience and an interest in this area, however it is of higher importance for us is to find someone who is just bursting with talent, demonstrating a product and customer-oriented mindset and a readiness to work in an agile way. We are looking for someone who wants to work with dedicated people, modern products and customers all over the world.
   

  

**The position can be based in the Aachen office or remotely within Germany, with occasional visits every few months. It can also be remote from Sweden or near Stockholm with similar office visits. Applicants must hold a valid Right to Work in either Germany or Sweden, depending on their location.**
**Responsibilities**
* Design and implement new functionality in our existing products
* Work in an agile development team to ensure proper implementation and high customer satisfaction
* Take responsibility for implementation of requirements and features, actively contribute to architectural decisions
* Cooperate with other teams concerning interfaces between the products of our PKI product family


**Skills And Qualifications** 
  

  

* Interested and experienced in agile ways of working
* Fluent in English and optionally German or Swedish
* Knowledgeable of software development in one or more of the following:
+ Linux and possibly Linux networking
+ Java Enterprise, Java
+ Javascript/ Typescript
+ Bash scripting, Python
+ Optionally: SQL, Embedded Software

* Experience in refining and designing product requirements and features
* Preferably experience with OCI Containers and continuous build systems
* Ideally experience in IT Security, PKI, open source software and hardware security modules
* Open-minded and flexible team player with the ability to inspire your colleagues with your expertise.
* Enthusiastic about working in a dynamic and expanding environment, focusing on with growing focus to making the product success and ensuring customer satisfaction.
* Driven and action-oriented
* Ability to work independently, proactively and responsibly, and willingness to take initiative
* Positive and customer-focused
* Structured and organized
* Excellent problem solving skills
* Team-oriented and cooperative mindset


**Compensation**
 Salary will be commensurate with experience.
   

  

**Culture, Career Opportunities And Benefits**
 We build teams that continually strive to get better than the day before. You will be challenged daily and given opportunities to grow personally and professionally. We balance autonomy and structure to create an entrepreneurial environment to spur creativity and new ideas.
   

  

 Here are just some of the initiatives that make our culture special:

* DIVERSE Commitment, a call to action for a more inclusive and diverse future in business, society, and technology.
* The Keyfactor Alliance Program to support DEIB efforts.
* Wellbeing resources, wellness allowance, mindfulness app free membership, Wellness Wednesdays.
* Global Volunteer Day, company non-profit matching, and 3 volunteer days off.
* Unlimited time off (US) and competitive time off globally.
* Monthly Talent development and Cross Functional meetings to support professional development.
* Regular All Hands meetings – followed by group gatherings.


**Our Core Values**
 Our core values are extremely important to how we run our business and what we look for in every team member:
   

  

**Trust** 
**is paramount.** 
  

  

*We deliver security software and solutions where trust and openness are of the highest importance for our customers. We are honest and a trusted partner in every aspect of business.*
**Customers** 
**are core.** 
  

  

*We strategize, operate, and execute through a customer-centric view. We prioritize the security interests of our customers, and we act as if their data were our own.*

**never stops, it only accelerates.** 
  

  

*The speed of change is accelerating. We are committed, through investment and focus, to stay ahead of the innovation curve.*
**We deliver with** 
**agility** 
**.** 
  

  

*We thrive in high-paced and continually changing environments. We navigate through newly added variables, adjust accordingly, while driving towards our strategic goals.*
**United by** 
**respect** 
**.** 
  

  

*Respect for all is what unites us. We promote diversity, inclusivity, equity, and acting with empathy and openness, both in our business and in our communities.*

title: Software Engineer
description:
***Dema.ai is a well-funded SaaS startup based in Stockholm with 30+ employees with a mission to help thousands of e-commerce businesses improve their profitability.***




  





**The role** 




 As a Software Engineer in the data team at Dema, you will be at the forefront of building the engine that powers our e-commerce analytics platform, helping merchants gain actionable insights through data. In this role, you will design, implement, and maintain robust solutions, while ensuring data quality, reliability, and availability across our systems. You will play a key role in our efforts to streamline and scale our analytics capabilities, contributing to a product that transforms how businesses understand and grow their sales and profitability.
 



 If tackling complex software engineering challenges excites you and you want to help shape the future of e-commerce analytics within a fast-paced startup environment, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**Your responsibilities** 



* Build and maintain the infrastructure of the data stack
* Work closely with product developers to deliver new data-driven features.
* Design data models that promote long-term stability, maintainability, and scalability.
* Build and maintain complex sql queries
* Build and maintain monitoring and alerting systems to ensure data pipeline reliability.
* Design, build, and maintain a cutting-edge data stack.
* Collaborate with data engineers to ensure the platform meets our high standards for scalability and performance.



  





**We are looking for** 




  





**Must have:** 



* 4+ years of software development experience with complex code bases.
* Expert in Python and SQL; experience in TypeScript or JavaScript is a plus.
* A collaborative mindset with excellent problem-solving and execution skills, eager to work across teams to deliver optimal solutions.



  





**Nice to have:** 



* Familiarity with orchestration tools like Prefect, Airflow or Dagster
* Infrastructure knowledge, we build on AWS, Kubernetes and TerraformKnowledge of data pipelines, ETL processes.



  





**Our tech stack** 




 Python, TypeScript, Prefect, Kubernetes, AWS
 



  





**Requirements:** 




 A valid work permit for Sweden, residence in Sweden, and availability to work from the office at least three days per week.
 



  





**You are just right for this role if you are:** 



* Enjoy solving complex problems.
* A proactive doer who takes pride in completing projects.
* Humble, open-minded, and team-oriented, valuing collaboration and knowledge-sharing.

title: Senior .NET-utvecklare, kort svarstid
description:
Vi söker en senior .NET-utvecklare för ett tidsbegränsat uppdrag på heltid från november till årsskiftet, med möjlighet till förlängning under januari 2025. Du kommer att arbeta med utvecklingen av en central webbplattform för vägledning inom lagstiftning och kontroll, med fokus på funktioner för remisshantering och prenumerationstjänster.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Som utvecklare blir du en nyckelresurs i ett projekt som ska lanseras vid årsskiftet. Du kommer att arbeta på plats cirka 60% av tiden, med möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 40%.
   

  

 Bra att ha med sig
   

  

* Hög kompetensnivå inom .NET.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med SQL och Azure DevOps.


 Har du detta är det ett plus
   

  

* Kunskaper i JavaScript och erfarenhet av att arbeta med legacykod.
* Erfarenhet av certifikathantering och användning av GitHub Copilot.


 Kort om rollen
   

  

* Omfattning: 100%
* Avtalstid: 1 november 2024 - 31 januari 2025, med möjlighet till förlängning i 6 månader
* Plats: Uppsala, med delvis distansarbete


 Detta är ett uppdrag för dig som snabbt vill göra skillnad i ett tekniskt projekt med stort genomslag.

title: Data Engineer
description:
At Coody, we're revolutionizing consulting by combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment. With us, you'll receive a maxed out salary with a full benefit package, the opportunity to work remotely and assignments that are both fun and challenging.
   

  

 On average, joining Coody means increasing your salary by 44%. How do we do it?
   

  

 The math is simple. We pay you more by cutting unnecessary costs — no overpaid bosses, no luxurious conferences, and no fancy offices. Instead, we invest in what matters: you.
   

  

 Coody is all about giving you as an individual the chance to have a free and flexible life to live for your own priorities. Welcome to Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

**Gravity Free Consulting @ Coody Means:**
* Maximized Compensation: Typically a 44% salary increase.
* Safety & Comfort: Employment with a generous benefits package.
* Freedom & Flexibility: No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
* Shaping the Future: Assignments with industry innovators like Topgolf, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, Paradox, Volvo Cars, Varjo, and exciting startups and scale-ups.


**About Us**
 Coody is a growing and dynamic group of people who are the tech stars of the future. We consists of about 13 different nationalities and work on assignments for digital game changers across Sweden, Finland, USA and the UK, in industries such as EV, Gaming, AI, MedTech, AR and FinTech.
   

  

 We’re more than a company — we’re a community platform. Our approach is built on trust and autonomy. We keep corporate bullshit to a minimum and focus on what benefits our consultants most. Explore our employee handbook for more insight into a genuine supportive, consultant-first environment.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 As a Data Engineer consultant you'll work on technically, intellectually challenging and fun assignments for companies to strengthen their teams and projects.
   

  

 You’ll be an integral part of the organisation and expected to design and setting up well-functioning fully automated data platforms and data pipelines, as well as contributing to ways of working and product strategy.
   

  

 You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience working as a Data Engineer
* Deep understanding of one or more technical areas stated below
* Fluency in English (verbal and written)
* Experience working in an agile environment
* A doers mindset with a proven track record of getting things done


**WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE THAT YOU HAVE**
**Experience** 
 from design, develop and maintain scalable data pipelines, infrastructure and tools
   

  

**Solid understanding** 
 of cloud based environments e.g. Azure, AWS or GCP
   

  

**Technical expertise** 
 with tools such as Python, Snowflake, Airflow, DBT, Tableu, ELT/ETL, BigQuery, Looker Studio, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, SQL
   

  

**An interest** 
 for becoming a wizard in Big data architecture
   

  

**A degree** 
 in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics
   

  

 If Gravity Free Consulting at Coody aligns with your goals, and you bring the skills we're seeking, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today, and we’ll get back to you within a week if your profile fits our needs.

title: Security Engineer
description:
*You know that corporate document or piece of research you know you have somewhere but you can’t seem to find it?* 
 🤯
 *The struggle to gather, organize and visualize all corporate knowledge and insights is real.* 




  





**We are Stravito and this is the problem we solve.** 




  





 Due to the universal nature of this problem, our customers come from various industries all around the world. We help world-leading organizations, such as McDonald’s, AT&T, Burberry and Heineken, get closer to their customers and make better, insights-backed decisions by organizing their knowledge and making it easy to access through our intuitive platform.
 



  





 We really mean it when we say we're a diverse and international team as our team of 100 has more than 30 different nationalities! We are guided by our operating principles: simplicity first, an “own it, do it” mentality, embracing different perspectives, and enjoying the journey together.
 



  





**About The Job** 




 As our first dedicated Security Engineer, you'll play a key role in ensuring the security of our platform. You will join a tech team with a great team environment and high quality standards, to go from good to great when it comes to security related topics. You will nurture a robust internal security community, evolving our bug bounty program, setting security standards for our production pipeline, and defining security measures for our GenAI features.
 



  





**Your Main Responsibilities Will Include** 



* Finding and fixing code vulnerabilities
* Testing and improving security in our AI pipelines
* Support other engineers in secure coding practices
* Lead and mentor our Security functional group
* Manage our bug bounty program.



  





**About You** 




 To succeed in this role you will need a solid understanding of software architecture and security, including compliance and regulations. We believe you have experience from back-end development, preferably in Java/Kotlin from working in a product company. You have extensive knowledge in AWS-specific security measures, as well as OWASP or similar frameworks. Certifications such as CSSLP or OSCP is a plus, as well as experience working with Python and TypeScript. With strong communication skills and a helpful approach, you effectively collaborate with a variety of stakeholders and team members. You have the ability to prioritize and advise in all things Security, both internally at Stravito and to our customers.
 



  





**What’s in it for you?** 




 You will join a remote-first and globally spread team, with company events a couple of times each year as the icing on the cake 🎂 We offer a fun, collaborative environment where everyone truly cares and helps each other. We have zero micro-management and instead you are encouraged to cultivate your own processes while giving and receiving feedback for improvement. Add to that a competitive compensation package, the possibility of working with cutting-edge technology in our industry (such as GenAI) and to be part of simplifying the professional lives of many - what’s not to like?
 



  





 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Backend Engineer (Go) - Data/Analytics
description:
We are looking for an engineer that will build the foundation for data driven player experiences. Leaderboards, character progressions, global events that will drive the narrative of the game, etc. In this role you will be responsible for building the framework that can be used by the game teams to deliver data into the persistent storage and then serve that data to support the game. You will also work on data applications that use and expose these data to your the players.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Design and maintain framework to persist player state
* Design and maintain Spanner tables to persist the data
* Help build data driven applications and experiences to delight our players
* Work closely with game teams to incorporate their feedback and requirements
* Optimize developer experience for the tools you are building


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* Good understanding of OLTP storage systems(we use Spanner)
* Experience working with distributed systems(consistency is important for this job!)
* Experience with driving architectural decisions from design to deployment
* Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple tasks and deadlines
* Experience with Go (or wide experience with multiple other languages)
* A passion to learn new things
* You like playing games!


**Additionally, these would be a great bonus:**
* Experience with GCP stack
* You thrive in a fast-paced environment where your skills depend on personal independence and agility


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!
   

  

*If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "* 
*Open Application.* 
*"*

title: Game Client Framework Developer
description:
Hacksaw Studios are looking for experienced developers to work with our framework for developing casino game clients. We are a relatively young company, but has quickly grown to be a top developer of casino-style games for the iGaming industry. Remote is possible, but we prefer if you are based in EU.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a framework developer you will work together with the game development teams to deliver features and tools that they need, as well as doing maintenance, bugfixes and performance or usability improvements on existing code. You need to be able to consider all the aspects of implementing a feature, how it affects long term developer productivity and/or memory, GPU and CPU performance. The framework team also handle for example CI pipelines, e2e tests and client integrations, and depending on your skills or interests there are plenty of different technologies to explore.
   

  

 There are very few meetings and a lot of freedom and responsibility to prioritize and specify scope of work, so a great opportunity if you are good at communicating to find the right solution, but also like to be productive and have time to focus on individual tasks.
   

  

**Relevant Experience/Skills**
* Worked with different game development frameworks and some understanding of how they handle structuring of code and rendering of graphics and sound. Ideally with games targeting web for deployment.
* Experience with developing modules and API's to be used by other developers.
* We use Haxe as a programming language for the game clients, but the role does not require previous experience. Haxe should be familiar and quick to learn if you have experience with any C-like language like C#, Java, C++, ActionScript, JS or TS, but if you only have experience with for example OCAML, Haskell or Clojure we would still like to hear from you.
* Our tech stack includes git, TypeScript, Linux, bash, npm, Bun, Docker, Cucumber, GitLab and AWS. Familiarity with any of those tools are beneficial but not required.
